description: Indices of A052344 (ways to write n as sum of two nonzero triangular numbers) where record values are reached.
comments: The subsequence of primes begins: 2, 1381, 1519133281 [_Jonathan Vos Post_, Feb 01 2011].
references: The College Mathematics Journal Vol. 30 No. 5, Nov. 1999 Problem 665 asks for the 48th number in this sequence.
example: The order of the terms is ignored when deciding in how many ways the sum can be expressed. For example, a(2) does not equal 9, although 9 = 3 + 6 = 6 + 3.a(2) = 16 because 16 = 1 + 15 = 6 + 10. a(3) = 81 because 81 = 3 + 78 = 15 + 66 = 36 + 55.
crossrefs: Probably differs from A052348 only at n=1, 2, 4. Cf. A000217, A052343-A052348.
author: _Jeremy Rouse_, Jan 19 2000
extensions: More terms from _Christian G. Bower_, Jan 23 2000
